ambient_events.message: The rising sun strikes the bronze doors, causing them to blaze with golden light!
The shadows lengthen across the mosaic floor as the sun sets.
A gentle breeze swirls leaves across the terrazzo mosaic.
The bronze doors hum faintly, as if responding to a distant bell.

description.default: A colossal archway of pale limestone dominates the view, positioned to swallow the first rays of the morning sun. The double doors are heavy timber plated in burnished bronze, embossed with a relief of a rising sun that seems to radiate a faint warmth even in the dead of night. The air here is crisp and carries the sharp, metallic scent of a brewing storm mixed with morning dew. Underfoot, a terrazzo mosaic spirals outward from a central eagle statue, its shadow creeping across the floor like the hand of a divine clock.

objects.description: Massive doors of gilded bronze depicting a rising sun.
objects.name: bronze doors

objects.description: A complex floor mosaic. A shadow cast by the eagle statue indicates the time of day.
objects.name: sun-dial mosaic

objects.description: A bronze dragon with spread wings.
objects.name: dragon statue

ambient_events.message: The Ever-Burning Brazier flares brightly for a moment, casting long shadows.
Faint chanting echoes from the upper galleries.
A beam of colored light from the crystal dome tracks across the floor.
An almoner walks quietly through the nave, carrying a basket of bread.
A group of pilgrims enters, kneeling in awe before the altar.

description.default: The vastness of this chamber presses down with a holy weight, a symphony of white marble and golden accents. Rows of high-backed pews carved from bleached ash wood stretch toward the dais, their surfaces worn smooth by generations of prayer. Above, the ceiling opens into a magnificent faceted crystal dome, splitting the natural light into dancing ribbons of color that wash over the congregation. The air is still and thick with the smell of beeswax and the silent hum of the Ever-Burning Brazier.

objects.description: A massive golden bowl holding a magical, heatless flame representing eternal vigilance.
objects.name: ever-burning brazier

objects.description: The center of worship, draped in cloth of gold.
objects.name: white marble altar

objects.description: A magnificent architectural feat that magnifies sunlight.
objects.name: crystal dome

ambient_events.message: A patient on one of the cots coughs weakly.
An acolyte hurries past with fresh bandages.
The smell of baking bread wafts in from the kitchens.

description.default: In contrast to the golden grandeur of the Nave, this long side chamber feels humble and grounded. It smells of yeast, strong soap, and the bitter tang of medicinal salves. Sturdy trestle tables line the center of the room, flanked by rows of simple cots where the infirm rest under heavy wool blankets. The plaster walls are vibrant with frescoes in ochre and gold, depicting Aethelion walking among the wounded, his hands glowing with a restorative, celestial fire.

objects.description: Paintings depicting the god Aethelion tending to wounded soldiers.
objects.name: frescoes

description.default: In contrast to the golden grandeur of the Nave, this long side chamber feels humble and grounded. It smells of yeast, strong soap, and the bitter tang of medicinal salves. Sturdy trestle tables line the center of the room, flanked by rows of simple cots where the infirm rest under heavy wool blankets. The plaster walls are vibrant with frescoes in ochre and gold, depicting Aethelion walking among the wounded, his hands glowing with a restorative, celestial fire.
A quiet gallery overlooking the Nave below. Sunlight streams in from the skylights. Doors lead north, south, and east.

This chamber radiates a martial austerity, the stone walls hung with tattered banners from crusades long past. The centerpiece is a massive, circular table hewn from a single slice of an ancient Ironwood tree, its surface scarred by the points of daggers used to mark maps of the realm. The chairs are banded in cold iron, and the room smells of oiled steel, leather, and the faint, coppery tang of old blood scrubbed from armor.

objects.description: The table surface is a relief map of the surrounding lands, marked with locations of known undead activity.
objects.name: round table

description.default: A reverent silence reigns here, defined by the scratching of quills and the turning of dry, cracking parchment. Floor-to-ceiling shelves groan under the weight of leather-bound tomes and scroll cases, accessible by rolling ladders of brass. Rows of slanted desks provide workspace for the scribes, illuminated not by candles, but by drifting orbs of trapped starlight that hover near the ceiling, ensuring no shadow ever falls across the holy texts.

objects.description: A magical magnifying glass fixed to a desk. Looking through it reveals faint magical auras.
objects.name: lens of scrutiny

description.default: This suite is a sanctuary of comfort amidst the stone, featuring plush rugs from distant, sun-drenched lands and a hearth that burns with glowing, smokeless embers. A large mahogany desk sits before a wall of private journals, but the room’s true secret lies behind a heavy velvet curtain. When drawn back, it reveals a hidden balcony offering a god’s-eye view of the Nave below, allowing the High Priest to watch the faithful with the silent scrutiny of a hawk.

objects.description: You can look down upon the worshippers in the Nave.
objects.name: balcony

description.default: The air turns cool and still. The stone walls are unadorned. To the north lies the Crypt; to the south, a heavy iron vault door; to the east, a dark cell.
A silent chamber for past heroes. The sarcophagi here are not stone, but heavy glass, preserving the bodies inside in a state of perfect repose.

objects.description: Through the glass, the warrior inside looks as if they are merely sleeping.
objects.name: glass sarcophagus

description.default: Secured behind a door of solid adamantine with no keyhole, this vault vibrates with a low, magical thrum. It is not a chaotic pile of loot, but a gallery of pedestals displaying golden chalices, jeweled reliquaries, and tithed gemstones that refract the room's defensive energies. The floor is etched with warning runes that pulse with a dull, red light, and the air tastes of charred air and static, hinting at the radiant fury waiting to be unleashed upon a thief.

objects.description: A pedestal engraved with the warning: 'Only the worthy may touch, lest the False Dawn take them.'
objects.name: stone pedestal

description.default: This chamber is an oppressive void, constructed of sound-dampening black basalt that seems to drink the light from your torch. There is no furniture and no warmth; only the cold stone floor and the crushing weight of absolute isolation. The ceiling is a seamless arch save for a single, finger-width bore-hole, magically aligned to admit a blinding, singular beam of sunlight only at high noon—a fleeting, cruel reminder of the warmth the prisoner has forfeited.

objects.description: A masterwork of engineering, aligning with the sun only at its zenith.
objects.name: tiny hole
